result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip G Lockhart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

  No bars or taverns.

No contact with any of the victims & any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Provide to PO names & numbers of doctors & pharmacys & sign release information for them.
.

PSI assigned Jacob Hinrichs
Sentencing hearing at 04-27-2016 02:30 pm

11:14 am Def in court w/ Atty Michael John Colgan.  Def in custody.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed.
  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Rights/elements/questions gone over with Mr. Lockhart.  No firearms or voting advised.  No threats/force/coercion.
16CF-66   Count 1 - Fel. Bail Jumping (new crime)    GUILTY.    Count 2 - Dismissed but read-in
16CF-16   Count 1 - Fel. Fraudulant Use of a Credit Card   GUILTY.    Counts 2 & 3 -  Dismissed but read-in
16CF-15   Count 2 - Misd. Obstructing an Officer  GUILTY     Count 1 - Dismissed but read-in
16CF-9     Count 1 - Misd. Theft   GUILTY     Count 2 - Dismissed but read-in
15CF-785  Count 1 - Fel. Bail Jumping (new crime)   GUILTY    Count 2 - Dismissed but read-in
15CF-611  Count 2 - Fel. Bail Jumping (new crime)   GUILTY    Count 1 - Dismissed but read-in
15CF-593  Count 1 - Fel.  Possession of Meth  GUILTY     Counts 2-7  Dismissed but read-in
COURT is satisfied that the pleas are F, I & V made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Accepts pleas.  Found guilty and convicted.
PSI DUE.  SENT HRG in 60 days.

Colgan would like to argue for a sig. bond.  Court reluctant until he's started the PSI process.  Colgan trying to get him into treatment....
COURT will not stand in the way with his achieving treatment.  He has to be evaluated for an AODA and then decide if it's inpatient treatment.  Treatment in the community would be a problem for me.  If there's an inpatient treatment facility available, I don't have an objection to release him for that purpose.
Bonds to continue.
